pages.text: Once you craft a turret, you can then place it on a solid surface (or in water in case of buoyant turrets).$(br)Turrets are stationary, but can be pushed by pistons or moved in a minecart.$(br2)Turrets have a certain amount of health and if damaged, can be repaired either with instant health potions or with $(l:misc/repair_kits)repair kits$(/l).

These need ammo to operate (which types of ammo a turret can accept is shown within their respective turret entry).$(br)To give them ammo, right-click a turret with a compatible ammo item (or a non-empty $(l:ammo/cartridge)ammo cartridge$(/l)).$(br2)Both amounts of ammo and health can be seen on the turret base, where you can see two "antennas", a red one for health and a blue one for ammo.

If they're upright, the turret is full with health/ammo and will appear to "fall down" once the amount of ammo/health decreases.$(br2)By default a turret only targets hostile creatures. Be careful, hostiles automatically try to defend themselves from turrets and attempt to damage them.

Turrets can be fitted with upgrades to further enhance their capabilities. To upgrade one, just right-click it with the upgrade in hand.$(br2)For further configuration, like custom targeting settings, dismantling the turret, etc., you need the $(l:misc/tcu)Turret Control Unit$(/l).
